Method Detail

fillEnharmonics

public static void fillEnharmonics(PitchSet ps1,
                                   Chord c1,
                                   PitchSet ps2,
                                   Chord c2Named,
                                   Key... k)
Fill in the NOTENAMES field for ps2 (if ps2.NOTENAMES is null - otherwise assume the values are accurate). Use this to determine the note names for c1 and ps1 on the assumption that moving notes should change in the heptatonic scale in a "readable" way. For instance, an Ab7 resolves to G in a German sixth. It resolves to C in a doubly augmented German sixth. You may specify a key to have c2 named after the key if its NOTENAMES field named after the key.

Parameters:
ps1 - pitchset that happens over c1, to be enharmonically named if NOTENAMES = null
c1 - chord under ps1, to be enharmonically named if NOTENAMES = null (can be the same chord as c2Named)
ps2 - pitchset that happens over c2Named, to be enharmonically named if NOTENAMES = null
c2Named - chord with NOTENAMES != null and assumed to be "valid" (heptatonic, any double flat/sharp allowed) under ps2
k - a Key (only one is needed) that we can fall back on, if it is provided

fillEnharmonics

public static void fillEnharmonics(PitchSet ps,
                                   Chord cNamed,
                                   Key... k)

fillEnharmonics

public static void fillEnharmonics(Chord c1,
                                   Chord c2Named)
Given two chords, one of which has its NOTENAMES field filled out, fills in the field for the other chord. It does so with a model that tries always name notes outside the second chord with names outside of the second chord while minimizing use of double accidentals.

Parameters:
c1 - a chord, must have NOTENAMES set to null to have any effect
c2Named - a chord with NOTENAMES set to a valid set of values

fillEnharmonics

public static void fillEnharmonics(PitchSet ps,
                                   Key k)

noteNameToPitchSet

public static PitchSet noteNameToPitchSet(java.lang.String noteName)

tryToName

public static java.lang.String tryToName(char heptatonicName,
                                         int targetTwelveTonePitchClass,
                                         boolean doubleAccidentals)
Given a letter A-G/a-g, returns a String with the needed (double)flats/sharps to make them equivalent, with C = 0, D = 2, E = 4, F = 5, G = 7, A = 9, B = 11 (i.e., traditional twelve-tone system at C = 0). Returns null if impossible. i.e., tryToName('C', 0, true/false) = "C", tryToName('B', 0, true/false) = "B#", tryToName('A', -1, true) = "A##", and tryToName('A', -1, false) = null

Parameters:
heptatonicName - a letter A-G
targetTwelveTonePitchClass - any numer (treated as C4=0 and so on, only its pitch class matters)
doubleAccidentals - true to enable double flats and sharps
Returns:

noteNameToInt

public static int noteNameToInt(java.lang.String noteName)
Can convert any named note (C, Eb, Bbb, Db6) into the appropriate string representation. If no octave is provided we assume we are in the 4th octave (above middle C, in the numeric range 0-11).

Parameters:
noteName -
Returns:

isFlat

public boolean isFlat(java.lang.String noteName)

Parameters:
noteName - ex. "F", "F#", "Eb4", "G" + Enharmonics.natural

fillEnharmonics

public static void fillEnharmonics(Chord c,
                                   Key k)
Fill in the enharmonics for a given chord using the given Key's way of naming notes. Useful if you know the Chord fits in the key (i.e., a cadence).

Parameters:
c -
k -
